column1: roth (pl. rodhin) is a Doriathrin word meaning "cave".
The word is a descendant form of ?Kornoldorin rōda > rōdh > rōth
The word is given in the The Etymologies to explain the name Menegroth. In a later source J.R.R. Tolkien gives the Sindarin word groth instead. p. 415 (note 26)
roth is an Adûnaic word meaning "foam". Its original sense was "cutting
column2: track" (as in the compounds obroth "fore-cutting" and nadroth "hind-track").
column4: http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/adunaic.htm Adûnaic: the vernacular of Númenor at Ardalambion (accessed 11 July 2011)
